alert.note: Alert for Bayamon; Catano; Dorado; Toa Baja; Vega Alta (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 27 at 11:36PM ADT until October 28 at 12:45AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Bayamon County in Puerto Rico... Catano County in Puerto Rico... Dorado County in Puerto Rico... Toa Baja County in Puerto Rico... Vega Alta County in Puerto Rico... * Until 1145 PM AST. * At 1036 PM AST, Radar and local emergency managers reported heavy rains have ended but light to moderate rains continue across the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. Excessive runoff from previous heavy rains. SOURCE...Radar and emergency managers. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Toa Alta, Toa Baja, Sabana Seca, Bayamon, Dorado, Vega Alta, Catano, Guaynabo, Ceiba, Candelaria, San Jose, Candelaria Arenas, Campanilla, Rio Lajas, Ingenio, Levittown, Brenas, Monserrate, Miranda and San Antonio. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Bayamon; Catano; Dorado; Toa Baja; Vega Alta
